newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Plains fed cattle bid $64, passed - feedlots.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Plains fed cattle bid $64, passed - feedlots.

text.p: U.S. Plains feedlot cattle bids early Friday at $64.00 per cwt were passed by owners asking $65.00 for any cattle remaining following this week's active trade, feedlot sources said.
Several cattle feeders said some owners were passing bids in anticipation of $65.00 sales next week.
Fed cattle prices next week were seen supported by smaller numbers on the showlist and outlooks for firm beef prices, the feeder sources said.
"After the volume we had this week, the list will come down," one Kansas feedlot manager said.
After dipping $0.28 per cwt on Wednesday, heavyweight choice beef rebounded $0.46 on Thursday to close at $103.27, up $4.23 since prices started trending higher on July 11, USDA statistics showed.
The brisk pace of this week's cattle sales, coupled with the rebound in beef values on Thursday fueled, optimisim for higher fed cattle prices next week, feedlot sources said.
Weekly movement in the Texas Panhandle and western Oklahoma area was pegged near 131,000 head and movement in Kansas was estimated near 95,000, according to USDA.
